hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util

Class Observers

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.Observers

  • public final class Observers
extends Object
    Utility class that helps in creating various observer instances.
    Since:
    0.97
    Author:
    akarnokd, 2013.01.10.

      • print

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Observer<T> print()
        Creates an observer with debugging purposes. It prints the submitted values to STDOUT separated by commas and line-broken by 80 characters, the exceptions to STDERR and prints an empty newline when it receives a finish().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type
        Returns:
        the observer

      • print

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Observer<T> print(String separator,
                            int maxLineLength)
        Creates an observer with debugging purposes. It prints the submitted values to STDOUT, the exceptions to STDERR and prints an empty newline when it receives a finish().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type
        Parameters:
        separator - the separator to use between subsequent values
        maxLineLength - how many characters to print into each line
        Returns:
        the observer

      • println

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Observer<T> println()
        Creates an observer with debugging purposes. It prints the submitted values to STDOUT with a line break, the exceptions to STDERR and prints an empty newline when it receives a finish().
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type
        Returns:
        the observer

      • select

        @Nonnull
public static <T,U> Observer<U> select(@Nonnull
                               Observer<? super T> observer,
                               @Nonnull
                               Func1<? super U,? extends T> selector)
        Modifies the source observer to use the selector to compute a new value from the received one.

        The error and finish events are forwarded without modification.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the source element type
        U - the result element type
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to modify behavior on
        selector - the selector to change the observed value
        Returns:
        the new observer

      • toObserver

        @Nonnull
public static OriginalObserverWrapper toObserver(@Nonnull
                                         Observer javaObserver,
                                         @Nullable
                                         Observable javaObservable)
        Converts the original Java Observer into a reactive-observer.

        The observer deregisters from the sender observable in case of error or finish.

        Parameters:
        javaObserver - the java observer
        javaObservable - the sender java observable
        Returns:
        the reactive-observable

      • toJavaObserver

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Observer toJavaObserver(Observer<T> observer)
        Wraps the reactive-observer into a java-observer.

        Note that since java-observer is non generic, ClassCastException might occur on the chain of reactive-observers in case an inproper object is propagated.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        observer - the reactive-observer to wrap
        Returns:
        the java-observer

      • registerWith

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Closeable registerWith(@Nonnull
                                 Observable javaObservable,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Observer<T> observer)
        Convenience method to let a reactive-observer register with a java-observable.

        The observer won't receive any error or finish events since java-observables don't have these concepts.

        Note that java-observables are not generic, therefore ClassCastException might occur if inproper values are sent through the reactive-observable chain.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        javaObservable - the observable used to register with.
        observer - the observer to use
        Returns:
        the closeable to unregister the observer

      • registerWith

        @Nonnull
public static Closeable registerWith(@Nonnull
                             Observable javaObservable,
                             @Nonnull
                             Observer javaObserver)
        Convenience method to register a java-observer with a java-observable in the same style as the reactive counterpart do.

        Note that java-observable prevents multiple registrations with the same java-observer instance, but there is no way to know if an observer is already registered. Therefore, in duplicate case the subsequent close handle will close the single registration.

        Parameters:
        javaObservable - the java-observable instance
        javaObserver - the java-observer instance
        Returns:
        the close handle

      • registerWith

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Closeable registerWith(@Nonnull
                                 Observable<T> observable,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Observer javaObserver)
        Convenience method to register a java-observable with a reactive-observable.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type of the reactive-observable
        Parameters:
        observable - the reactive-observable to register with
        javaObserver - the java-observer to register
        Returns:
        the close handler to deregister the observer

      • registerWith

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Closeable registerWith(@Nonnull
                                 Iterable<T> iterable,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Observer<? super T> observer)
        "Registers" the observer with the iterable source and iterates over the source iterable in the current thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable sequence
        observer - the observer
        Returns:
        the close handler

      • registerWith

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Closeable registerWith(@Nonnull
                                 Iterable<T> iterable,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Observer<? super T> observer,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Scheduler scheduler)
        "Registers" an observer with the given iterable and iterates over it on the given scheduler. Each iteration is run as a new task.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable source
        observer - the observer
        scheduler - the scheduler
        Returns:
        the closeable to cancel the operation

      • registerSafe

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Closeable registerSafe(@Nonnull
                                 Observable<? extends T> source,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 Observer<? super T> observer)
        Registers the observer with the source in a way that if the registration call throws an exception, it is routed to the observer via the error() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        source - the source observable
        observer - the observer to register
        Returns:
        the close handle for the registration
        Since:
        0.97
